SEARCH
Package com.root14.barcodeservice

Class DynamicBeanManager

java.lang.Object
com.root14.barcodeservice.DynamicBeanManager
public class DynamicBeanManager extends Object
A utility class for dynamically registering and retrieving beans at runtime using a local DefaultListableBeanFactory.

This class allows you to register new beans programmatically with optional property values and retrieve them by name or type. It is useful in scenarios where bean definitions need to be created on-the-fly outside the standard Spring configuration lifecycle.

Note: This class manages its own isolated DefaultListableBeanFactory and does not integrate with the main Spring application context.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DynamicBeanManager()
    Constructs a new DynamicBeanManager with its own internal DefaultListableBeanFactory.

  • Method Details

    • registerBean

      public <T> void registerBean(String beanName, Class<T> beanClass, Map<String,Object> properties)
      Registers a new bean definition with the given name, type, and optional properties.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the bean
      Parameters:
      beanName - the name of the bean to register
      beanClass - the class of the bean
      properties - a map of property names and values to set on the bean (maybe null or empty)

    • getBean

      public <T> T getBean(Class<T> clazz)
      Retrieves a bean by its type.
      Type Parameters:
      T - the type of the bean
      Parameters:
      clazz - the class type of the desired bean
      Returns:
      the bean instance
      Throws:
      org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException - if no bean of the specified type is found

    • getBean

      public Object getBean(String beanName)
      Retrieves a bean by its name.
      Parameters:
      beanName - the name of the bean
      Returns:
      the bean instance
      Throws:
      org.springframework.beans.factory.NoSuchBeanDefinitionException - if no bean with the specified name is found

    • containsBean

      public boolean containsBean(String beanName)
      Checks whether a bean with the specified name is registered.
      Parameters:
      beanName - the name of the bean
      Returns:
      true if the bean exists; false otherwise
